title: Larsen & Toubro shares trade flat; touches day's high of Rs 3,550
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading at Rs 3,528.60 in Tuesday's session at 11:30 am, a marginal decline of 0.03 percent from the previous close. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 3,550 and a day's low of Rs 3,527. Financial Performance: Larsen & Toubro's consolidated financial performance shows the following trends: Quarterly Results: The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,678.92 Crore, compared to Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 4,325.57 Crore, up from Rs 3,440.11 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The earnings per share (EPS) increased to Rs 26.30 in June 2025 from Rs 20.26 in June 2024. Annual Results: For the year-ending March 2025, Larsen & Toubro reported a revenue of Rs 255,734.45 Crore, a significant increase from Rs 221,112.91 Crore in March 2024. The net profit also rose to Rs 17,687.39 Crore from Rs 15,569.72 Crore during the same period. The company's EPS stood at Rs 109.36 in March 2025, compared to Rs 93.96 in March 2024. title: Tata Consultancy Services shares rise 0.99% in morning trade
content: Shares of Tata Consultancy Services were trading at Rs 3,048.90 in Tuesday's session, a 0.99% increase from the previous close, as of 11:40 am. The stock, a constituent of the Nifty 50 index, touched a day's high of Rs 3,060.00 and a day's low of Rs 3,030.80. Financial Performance: Tata Consultancy Services' consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth. The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,437 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 62,613 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 12,819 Crore, up from Rs 12,105 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS also increased from Rs 33.28 in June 2024 to Rs 35.27 in June 2025. The yearly consolidated revenue for Tata Consultancy Services has shown a steady increase over the past five years. In March 2025, the revenue was Rs 255,324 Crore, compared to Rs 240,893 Crore in March 2024. Net profit also increased, from Rs 46,099 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 48,797 Crore in March 2025. The EPS rose from Rs 125.88 in March 2024 to Rs 134.19 in March 2025. The following table presents the key financial figures:Financials (Consolidated)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 62,613.00 CroreRs 64,259.00 CroreRs 63,973.00 CroreRs 64,479.00 CroreRs 63,437.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 12,105.00 CroreRs 11,955.00 CroreRs 12,444.00 CroreRs 12,293.00 CroreRs 12,819.00 CroreEPS33.2832.9234.2133.7935.27Financials (Consolidated)20212022202320242025RevenueRs 164,177.00 CroreRs 191,754.00 CroreRs 225,458.00 CroreRs 240,893.00 CroreRs 255,324.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 32,562.00 CroreRs 38,449.00 CroreRs 42,303.00 CroreRs 46,099.00 CroreRs 48,797.00 CroreEPS86.71103.62115.19125.88134.19BVPS235.43245.48249.20252.26261.76ROE37.5242.9946.6150.7351.24Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00Income Statement: The consolidated income statement for the year ending March 2025 shows sales of Rs 255,324 Crore, other income of Rs 3,962 Crore, and total income of Rs 259,286 Crore. Total expenditure was Rs 193,159 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 66,127 Crore. Interest paid was Rs 796 Crore, and tax amounted to Rs 16,534 Crore, leading to a net profit of Rs 48,797 Crore. Corporate Actions: Tata Consultancy Services has announced several press releases. On September 5, 2025, TCS was selected by the Government of Odisha to build a next-gen, AI-enabled integrated financial management system. Additionally, on September 3, 2025, TCS and IIT Kanpur partnered to pioneer AI-powered urban planning for sustainable cities. The company has also announced dividends. An interim dividend of Rs 11.00 per share (1100%) was announced on June 27, 2025, with an effective date of July 16, 2025. A final dividend of Rs 30.00 per share (3000%) was announced on April 11, 2025, effective June 4, 2025. The company issued bonus shares in the ratio of 1:1, with exbonus date as May 31, 2018; record date as June 02, 2018; announcement date as April 19, 2018. Tata Consultancy Services' stock was trading at Rs 3,048.90, a 0.99% increase from the previous close as of 11:40 am.

title: Buy Ujjivan Small Finance Bank; target of Rs 55 : ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities research report on Ujjivan Small Finance Bank Ujjivan Small Finance Bank (Ujjivan) is amongst the few SFBs which had been successful in scaling loan portfolio to INR 333bn by Q1FY26 from INR 75bn in FY18 with an average credit cost of ~150bps (ex-Covid). While the transition from an NBFC to SFB was a challenging journey, Ujjivan demonstrated strong execution, as reflected in the gradual build-up of liability franchise (~25% CASA as on Jun’25) along with managing its assets (also pivoting from unsecured portfolio). Building upon its strong foundation it laid between FY17-25, it unveiled a strategic roadmap to achieve RoA of 1.8-2.0% with RoE of 16-18% by FY30 with a focus on loan diversification, strengthening liability franchise and improving branch productivity. It plans to deliver ~25% loan growth and scale credit portfolio to INR 1trn, improve the share of secured portfolio to 65-70% (currently 46%), expand CASA ratio to 35% (24.3% as on Jun’25) and bring down C/I to 55% by FY30. Outlook Retain BUY with an unchanged TP of INR 55, valuing the stock at 1.5x on Sep’26E BVPS. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Ujjivan Small Finance Bank - 09092025 - icici

title: Buy CESC; target of Rs 204 : ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities research report on CESC We attended the RP-Sanjiv Goenka Group Investor Day 2025 this week where CESC unveiled its ‘Growth Vision 2030’. At the crux, it seeks to double profits by FY30 via the levers of Distribution Company (DISCOM) capex, RE generation and solar manufacturing. In order to achieve this, management has outlined an INR 320bn capex plan; within which, INR 230bn shall be earmarked for RE generation capacity, INR 60bn for distribution assets and INR 30bn for solar manufacturing over the next five years. Apart from building its businesses, CESC aims to win DISCOM bids. UP plans to privatise its DISCOMs due to AT&C losses of >30%. The DISCOMs have 17.5mn customers with consumption of ~65BU. Five major bids at UP are expected in the medium term. Retain BUY and TP of INR 204. Outlook We reiterate BUY with an SoTP-based TP of INR 204. title: Nifty IT index rises 3%, snaps five-day losses; Infosys, Wipro lead gains: Here are three reasons
content: The shares of IT companies surged on September 9, pushing the sectoral index sharply into the green. The Nifty IT index rose nearly 3 percent, snapping a five-day losing streak. The IT index ended the session at 35,255.90. It was the top sectoral gainer on the market today. Infosys shares led the gains, jumping nearly 5 percent to trade at Rs 1,502.40 apiece. Wipro shares followed, surging nearly 3 percent. Tech Mahindra, Persistent Systems and Mphasis shares gained more than 2 percent each, while Coforge, LTI Mindtree and HCL Technologies shares rose nearly 2 percent. Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) shares were up more than 1 percent. Here are the possible triggers for the sharp rise: US Fed rate cut expectations: The US Federal Reserve is set to hold its FOMC meeting from September 16 to September 17. Analysts increasingly expect the American central bank to cut its rates this time, amid weakening jobs data and rising pressure from President Donald Trump's administration. Analysts now expect a 50-basis point rate cut at the September FOMC meeting. "August labor market data has paved the way for a 'catch-up' 50 basis point rate cut at the September FOMC meeting, similar to what occurred at this time last year," said Standard Chartered in its latest note, doubling its earlier projection of a 25-bp reduction, following a soft August jobs report. A rate cut in the US will likely increase the discretionary spending capacity, which will likely help the IT companies which derive a major portion of their revenue from the American market. Infosys board to consider share buyback proposal: The shares of Infosys jumped more than 4 percent after the company announced that its board will meet on September 11 to consider a proposal for buyback of fully paid-up equity shares. If approved, this will be the first buyback of shares announced by India's second-largest IT firm since 2022, when the company had agreed to a buyback proposal of Rs 9,300 crore with a minimum buyback price of Rs 1,850 per share. Infosys made the announcement in the post market hours of September 8. The stock jumped more than 4 percent to trade at Rs 1,494 apiece on September 9, snapping a five-session losing streak. It is currently the top gainer on the Nifty IT index, as well as benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty. The sharp rise in heavyweight Infosys was the top contributor to the rise in the Nifty IT index. Value buying: The IT stocks have seen significant correction in recent days, amid tariff uncertainties and global worries. The Nifty IT index dropped nearly 4 percent in just five consecutive sessions. The sharp rise in the sector today may come as investors resort to value buying after significant correction. "The IT stocks' rise today, especially with Infosys' buyback offer, highlights the speed at which sentiment can shift to positive when there are global and local triggers. The dual tailwinds from GST rationalization and anticipation of a U.S. Fed rate reduction are acting as a long-needed support to Indian equities, insulating them from global tariff and demand uncertainties," said Siddharth Maurya, Founder & Managing Director, Vibhavangal Anukulakara Pvt. Ltd. "Though the IT industry has taken a hit this year, these decisions are evidence of resilience and the industry's core position in India's growth narrative. To investors, it is a reminder that long-term value resides in remaining aligned to structural pillars, even in times of short-term churn," the analyst added. Bhavik Joshi, Business Head, INVasset PMS, however advised caution. "Foreign investors remain cautious, discouraging a sustained rally. While local policy cues and GST relief offer seasonal optimism, the lack of a sharp earnings turnaround or acceleration in contract wins keeps sentiment muted. The buyback announcement from Infosys may provide a short-lived jolt, yet the broader narrative remains one of structural caution rather than exuberance," he said. "In essence, what separates IT from other sectors today is the 'global tether'. The expectation of a U.S. rate cut may lift overall market sentiment, but until global tech spend and deal pipelines visibly recover, IT will lag broader indices. For now, this underperformance reflects prudence—not weakness—and positions IT for a selective comeback once global visibility returns," he added. Renewed optimism around capital allocation, coupled with easing rate-cut expectations globally, fueled broad-based gains across the sector, said Ajit Mishra – SVP, Research, Religare Broking. "However, participants shouldn't get carried away with a single day move and should wait for some signs of stability citing the prolonged underperformance," he added. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: FSN E-Commerce Nykaa, One 97 Paytm stocks among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150

title: Industrial gas supplier Ellenbarrie has ambitious expansion plans, MOSL initiates coverage with a Buy
content: Motilal Oswal has initiated coverage on Ellenbarrie Industrial Gases, a recently listed manufacturer and supplier of gases for various sectors, assigning a Buy rating with a target price of Rs 680, a 30 percent upside from the last closing price. Shares of Ellenbarrie are higher by close to two percent in trade on September 9, and since listing in July 2025, it has been flattish with a 2.2 percent loss. Ellenbarrie has a market capitalisation of over Rs 7,700 crore, and for the June quarter, the company posted a 24 percent on-year growth in revenue and almost 40 percent rise in in EBITDA. EBITDA margins for the quarter came in at about 37 percent, which the management said may improve further going ahead. MOSL has projected a revenue and PAT CAGR of 39% and 52% respectively over FY25-28, supported by argon contribution, green energy push, and capacity addition. The company said it is expecting one of its merchant plants in East India to commence operation from October 2025, and another on-site plant from March 2026. Ellenbarrie is looking at building additional merchant and on-site capacities for its core business of ASU gases. Ellenbarrie makes and supplies oxygen, nitrogen, argon, hydrogen, helium, and carbon dioxide to a range of sectors such as steel, pharma, healthcare, engineering, defense, energy, and food & beverages, with recurring demand and a long-term clientele. The company has been focusing on geographical expansion. "Our focus shall be on geographical expansion as well and we hope to be a Pan-India company very shortly. We are looking at inorganic growth in synergistic areas, acquisition of our cylinder filling assets in Bangalore is a move in that direction," said Padam K Agarwala, the CMD of the company had said during the June earnings call. MOSL in its note said that it sees India's industrial gas demand reaching $1.75 billion by CY28 from $1.3 billion in CY24 at a CAGR of 7.5 percent. "The company has scaled its capacity 4.5x over FY23-25 to 3,870 tonne per day (TPD), led by 18x growth in onsite capacity from 176 TPD in FY23 to 3,172 TPD in FY25. Ellen aims to increase its capacity to 4,630 TPD by FY27," MOSL note mentioned. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: CG Power shares fall 2.04%; stock among top losers on Nifty Next 50
content: CG Power and Industrial Solutions shares declined by 2.04%, trading at Rs 731.15 at 10:41 am. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Next 50 index. In corporate actions, the company announced the allotment of 71,980 equity shares pursuant to the Company's ESOP Plan 2021 on September 3, 2025. The company has a history of dividend payouts. An interim dividend of Rs 1.30 per share (65%) was announced on March 18, 2025, with an effective date of March 21, 2025. Another interim dividend of Rs 1.30 per share was announced on January 23, 2024, with an effective date of February 5, 2024. The company also issued bonus shares, most recently on January 28, 2010, in the ratio of 3:4, with an ex-bonus date of March 8, 2010. title: Infosys shares rise 3.64% in morning trade
content: Shares of Infosys were trading at Rs 1,485 in Tuesday's session, marking a 3.64% increase. As of 10:40 am, the stock had touched a day's high of Rs 1,489.00 and a day's low of Rs 1,472.50. This performance places the stock among the top gainers; the stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. Financial Performance: Infosys has demonstrated steady financial performance. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 42,279 Crore, up from Rs 39,315 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 6,924 Crore, compared to Rs 6,374 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also increased to Rs 16.70 in June 2025 from Rs 15.38 in June 2024. For the year-ending March 2025, Infosys reported a consolidated revenue of Rs 162,990 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 153,670 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the year was Rs 26,750 Crore, compared to Rs 26,248 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The EPS for the year stood at Rs 64.50, up from Rs 63.39 in the previous year. title: Infosys, Wipro, Dr Reddys Labs shares among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: At 10:30 am, the Nifty 50 index saw several stocks trading in positive territory, with Infosys, Wipro, and Dr Reddys Labs leading the gains. Infosys shares rose 3.71% to Rs 1,486.00, Wipro shares gained 2.46% to Rs 248.49, and Dr Reddys Labs shares increased by 1.96% to Rs 1,275.10. Tech Mahindra and Eicher Motors also showed positive movement, gaining 1.77% and 1.67% respectively. title: Waaree Energies shares rise 2.16% in morning trade

title: One 97 Paytm among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150; shares decline 2.63%
content: Shares of One 97 Paytm were trading down 2.63%, at Rs 1,220.00 on Tuesday. The stock was identified among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 10:30 am. title: Buy 3M India; target of Rs 35,610 : ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities research report on 3M India We remain constructive on 3M India after analysing its FY25 annual report. Takeaways: (1) There is focus on local manufacturing. Revenues from local manufacturing have increased from 52.9% in FY14 to 59.4% in FY25. (2) There is a steady increase in the number of distributors from 1,005 in FY23 to 1,123 in FY25. There is also an increase in Qcommerce and products are now available in 100 cities. (3) Royalty and corporate management fees were 4.8% of net sales. This is lower than 6.2% in FY19. As domestic manufacturing increases, royalty payments may increase. (4) There is a steady flow of product launches, even in FY25, and 3M India also plans to launch products for India’s EV segment. (5) The Chairman and MD’s letters also indicated that there are opportunities in driving growth in rural markets and also in digital transformation. Outlook We maintain BUY with a DCF-based TP of INR 35,610, implying target P/E of 56x FY27E. title: Glenmark shares higher as subsidiary gets $700 million from NYSE-listed AbbVie in licensing deal
content: Glenmark Pharma's wholly owned subsidiary, Ichnos Glenmark Innovation (IGI) has received an upfront payment of $700 million from NYSE-listed AbbVie for a molecule used in cancer treatment, the company informed exchanges, sending the shares higher by over two percent in early trade on September 9. "The payment is in accordance with the agreed contractual terms and is being made towards an exclusive global licensing agreement for IGI’s lead investigational molecule- ISB 2001 - across North America, Europe, Japan, and Greater China markets," Glenmark Pharma said. Earlier this year, Ichnos Glenmark Innovation (IGI) and AbbVie had announced an exclusive Global LicensingAgreement for ISB 2001, which is a Trispecific Antibody for Multiple Myeloma. Under the terms of thefirst-of-its-kind agreement for an Indian biotech player, AbbVie has exclusive rights to develop, manufacture, and commercialize ISB 2001 in North America, Europe, Japan, and Greater China. Read More: A $2 billion shot in the arm: Why Glenmark’s AbbVie deal could trigger re-rating The exclusive global licensing pact features $700 million as upfront payment and $1.225 billion in milestones, in addition to tiered, double-digit royalties on net sales. In an interview with Moneycontrol on July 14, Glenn Saldanha, Chairman and Managing Director of Glenmark said the deal with AbbVie has 'de-risked' the company and made the R&D unit self-sufficient and self-sustaining for at least 3-4 years. "Effectively, by partnering, we've passed on the risk and de-risked ourselves. We've taken some money off the table. Crucially, we've retained the rights for emerging markets, including India. So, we've basically de-risked part of the asset by partnering with a big pharma and effectively monetising it," Glenn Saldanha said. Glenmark is India’s 11th largest pharma company by market capitalisation and 12th in terms of FY25 revenue.

title: Adani Power share price rises 2.11%
content: Adani Power shares are trading higher in today's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 647.20, a 2.11% increase from its previous close. At 09:59 am, the stock is trading positive. Financial Snapshot: The following table presents a summary of Adani Power's key financial data:Financials (Consolidated)Mar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025Revenue (Rs Crore)26,221.4827,711.1838,773.3050,351.2556,203.09Net Profit (Rs Crore)1,269.984,911.5810,726.6420,828.7912,749.61EPS0.069.6324.5751.6232.32BVPS1.2914.2342.5692.26138.17ROE255.2289.4865.3558.5324.27Debt to Equity99.588.862.560.960.71Adani Power has demonstrated substantial revenue growth over the past five years. The company's revenue increased from Rs 26,221.48 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 56,203.09 Crore in March 2025. Net profit has also seen a significant rise, although it experienced a decrease in 2025 to Rs 12,749.61 Crore compared to Rs 20,828.79 Crore in the previous year. EPS has grown consistently, reaching Rs 32.32 in March 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio has significantly improved, indicating better financial health. Quarterly Financial Performance (Consolidated):ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025Revenue (Rs Crore)14,955.6313,338.8813,671.1814,237.4014,109.15Net Profit (Rs Crore)3,912.793,297.522,940.072,599.233,305.13EPS9.728.217.676.628.62Examining the quarterly results, Adani Power's revenue was Rs 14,109.15 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025, slightly lower than the Rs 14,237.40 Crore in the previous quarter. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 3,305.13 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 2,599.23 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025. The EPS stood at Rs 8.62 for the quarter-ending June 2025. The company announced a share split, with the record date yet to be determined. The old face value was Rs 10, and the new face value is Rs 2. As of a recent Moneycontrol analysis, the sentiment for Adani Power is very bullish.

title: Infosys shares rise 2.87% in early trade on Tuesday
content: Infosys shares gained 2.87% to trade at Rs 1,474.00 in Tuesday's session. Early trading saw positive movement for the stock, which is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. On the financial front, Infosys has demonstrated consistent growth. Consolidated quarterly revenue increased from Rs 39,315.00 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 42,279.00 Crore in June 2025. The net profit also saw a rise, from Rs 6,374.00 Crore to Rs 6,924.00 Crore over the same period. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased from Rs 15.38 in June 2024 to Rs 16.70 in June 2025. The following table summarizes the quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 39,315.00 CroreRs 40,986.00 CroreRs 41,764.00 CroreRs 40,925.00 CroreRs 42,279.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 6,374.00 CroreRs 6,516.00 CroreRs 6,822.00 CroreRs 7,038.00 CroreRs 6,924.00 CroreEPS15.3815.7116.4316.9816.70Infosys has also shown robust annual financial performance. The consolidated revenue increased from Rs 153,670.00 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 162,990.00 Crore in March 2025. Net profit rose from Rs 26,248.00 Crore to Rs 26,750.00 Crore, and EPS increased from Rs 63.39 to Rs 64.50. Additionally, the Book Value Per Share (BVPS) increased from Rs 212.74 in March 2024 to Rs 231.11 in March 2025. The table below highlights Infosys's yearly financials:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,472.00 CroreRs 121,641.00 CroreRs 146,767.00 CroreRs 153,670.00 CroreRs 162,990.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 19,423.00 CroreRs 22,146.00 CroreRs 24,108.00 CroreRs 26,248.00 CroreRs 26,750.00 CroreEPS45.6152.5257.6363.3964.50BVPS180.75180.50183.17212.74231.11ROE25.3429.3431.9529.7727.87Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00According to the annual income statement, Infosys's sales increased from Rs 153,670 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 162,990 Crore in March 2025. Other income decreased from Rs 4,711 Crore to Rs 3,600 Crore during the same period. The total expenditure rose from Rs 121,923 Crore to Rs 128,566 Crore. The Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) increased from Rs 36,458 Crore to Rs 38,024 Crore. The net profit increased from Rs 26,248 Crore to Rs 26,750 Crore. According to the quarterly income statement, Infosys's sales increased from Rs 40,925 Crore in March 2025 to Rs 42,279 Crore in June 2025. Other income decreased from Rs 1,190 Crore to Rs 1,042 Crore during the same period. The total expenditure rose from Rs 32,350 Crore to Rs 33,476 Crore. The Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) increased from Rs 9,765 Crore to Rs 9,845 Crore. The net profit decreased from Rs 7,038 Crore to Rs 6,924 Crore. Key financial ratios for Infosys show a P/E ratio of 24.35 and a P/B ratio of 6.80 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. The company’s board is scheduled to meet on September 11, 2025, to consider a proposal for the buyback of equity shares. The company had announced a final dividend of Rs 22 per share with effective date as May 30, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis, conducted on September 3, 2025, indicated a bearish sentiment for the stock.

title: Tech Mahindra shares rise 2.12% in early trade
content: Tech Mahindra shares gained 2.12% to trade at Rs 1,491.60 in early trade. At 09:45 am, the stock showed positive movement, reflecting an increase from its previous close. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. Regarding the company's financial performance, the consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 13,351.20 Crore, compared to Rs 13,384.00 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the June 2025 quarter was Rs 1,128.30 Crore, while the EPS was Rs 12.87. Here's a more detailed look at Tech Mahindra's financial data:Financials (Consolidated Quarterly)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 13,005.50 CroreRs 13,313.22 CroreRs 13,285.60 CroreRs 13,384.00 CroreRs 13,351.20 CroreNet ProfitRs 862.20 CroreRs 1,256.88 CroreRs 982.20 CroreRs 1,143.10 CroreRs 1,128.30 CroreEPS9.6214.1211.1013.1712.87The annual consolidated financial performance reveals the following:Financials (Consolidated Yearly)20212022202320242025RevenueRs 37,855.10 CroreRs 44,646.00 CroreRs 53,290.20 CroreRs 51,995.50 CroreRs 52,988.30 CroreNet ProfitRs 4,351.80 CroreRs 5,627.30 CroreRs 4,886.00 CroreRs 2,386.30 CroreRs 4,244.40 CroreEPS50.6463.3254.7626.6648.00BVPS288.78311.99322.65307.56309.24ROE17.8120.7017.308.8415.53Debt to Equity0.070.060.060.060.02The revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 52,988.30 Crore, compared to Rs 51,995.50 Crore in March 2024. Net profit stood at Rs 4,244.40 Crore for the year ending March 2025, up from Rs 2,386.30 Crore in March 2024. The EPS increased from 26.66 to 48.00 during the same period. Key ratios include a basic EPS of Rs 48.00 and diluted EPS of Rs 47.91 as of March 2025. The book value per share was Rs 309.24. The company’s dividend per share was Rs 45.00, and the face value was Rs 5. The debt to equity ratio stood at 0.02 as of March 2025. Regarding corporate actions, the company announced a final dividend of Rs 30.00 per share (600%) on April 24, 2025, with an effective date of July 4, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 15.00 per share (300%) was announced on October 21, 2024, with an effective date of October 31, 2024. The company had allotted equity shares pursuant to exercise of Employee Stock Options on September 4, 2025. Tech Mahindra shares gained 2.12% to trade at Rs 1,491.60 in early trade.

title: One 97 Communications Paytm shares fall 2.03% in early trade
